amp4email.description: Support for rendering emails in the AMP format.

notes.1: Buggy. Element's content are still kept.
Buggy. `title` attribute is removed but keeps `<acronym>` tag.
Unsupported opening and closing tags are stripped.
Does not play.
notes.2: The `src` attribute is transformed into `proton-src`.
notes.3: The `<audio>` element is supported but can not be played.
notes.4: The `<audio>` element is supported, but the video can not play due to a strict Content Security Policy.
notes.5: Not supported. The `<audio>` element and all its content is removed.
notes.6: Not supported. The `src` attribute is replaced by `data-src`.

audio.description: This is the description of the `<audio>` element.

notes.1: Buggy. The element is removed but URLs are turned into links with `href` attribute.
notes.2: Buggy. URLs are computed based on the first `<base>` element found in the `<body>`.
notes.3: Buggy. URLs are computed based on the last `<base>` element found in the `<body>`.
notes.4: Buggy. Not supported for local anchor links.

base.description: Specifies the base URL to use for all relative URLs in a document.

notes.1: Partial. Replaced by a `<div>` with supported attributes.

body.description: Represents the content of an HTML document.

notes.1: Buggy. Blockquote elements are nested in a `<details>` element.

notes.2: Buggy. Interacting with the element submits the form it belongs in.
notes.3: Partial. The element is present but is not interactive.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
notes.2: Partial. The element is present but is not interactive.

notes.1: Not supported. The tags are removed but the content is kept.

code.description: A short fragment of computer code.

notes.1: Partial. The `title` attribute is removed.

dfn.description: It is used to identify a term that is going to be described within the content.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
Buggy. The client applies an `rtl` direction to the entire email if it contains text in a `rtl` language.
notes.2: Partial. Removed from `<table>` and `<td>` elements.
notes.3: Buggy on anchor `<a>` tags.
notes.4: Buggy. LTR text in `[dir=rtl]` (and vice versa) is rendered with reversed word order.

dir.description: Indicates the directionality of the element's text.

img.description: Displays an image into the document

usemap.description: `` with a `usemap` attribute and associated `` with a `name` attribute and descendant `` elements define a client-side image map.

notes.1: Does not submit in iOS with non Google accounts.
notes.2: On submit name values are prefixed with `x_`.
notes.3: Does not submit in preview pane, but does when the email is opened in a new window.
notes.4: Not supported. `<form>` is transformed into `<noform>`.
notes.5: Not supported. The `<form>` and its entire content is removed.
notes.6: Not supported. The `<form>` is there but values are not submitted.

form.description: The ability to submit an HTML form via email, this requires support of at least one form element, at least one form method and either input submit or button submit to pass data to an end point.

notes.1: The webmail sets `<h1>` to `color:#fff` and `<h2>` to `background:#354963`.

notes.1: Partial. The `reversed` attribute on `<ol>` is not supported.
notes.2: Partial. Setting the `value` attribute to an `<li>` within an `<ol>` results in a different behaviour in comparison to browsers. The `<ol>` tag is closed before the `<li value="">`. A new `<ol>` is added with the `start` attribute on it set to the value of the `value` attribute of the `<li>`.

ul.description: Support for lists in HTML: `<ul>`, `<ol>`, `<li>`, `<dl>`, `<dt>` and `<dd>` elements.

notes.1: Partial. The `reversed` attribute on `<ol>` is not supported.
notes.2: Partial. Setting the `value` attribute to an `<li>` within an `<ol>` results in a different behaviour in comparison to browsers. The `<ol>` tag is closed before the `<li value="">`. A new `<ol>` is added with the `start` attribute on it set to the value of the `value` attribute of the `<li>`.

ol.description: Support for lists in HTML: `<ul>`, `<ol>`, `<li>`, `<dl>`, `<dt>` and `<dd>` elements.

notes.1: Partial. The `reversed` attribute on `<ol>` is not supported.
notes.2: Partial. Setting the `value` attribute to an `<li>` within an `<ol>` results in a different behaviour in comparison to browsers. The `<ol>` tag is closed before the `<li value="">`. A new `<ol>` is added with the `start` attribute on it set to the value of the `value` attribute of the `<li>`.

dl.description: Support for lists in HTML: `<ul>`, `<ol>`, `<li>`, `<dl>`, `<dt>` and `<dd>` elements.

name||theme-color.description: Changes the default colors of HTML elements. Useful for when you want an email to display only in a dark color scheme or only a light scheme, regardless of user settings. Equivalent to setting the color-scheme CSS property on the root element

notes.1: Partial. Not supported inside the `<body>`.
notes.2: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
notes.3: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.
notes.4: Buggy. `<style>` elements need to be declared before their rules are used.
notes.5: A CSS rule following a CSS comment is ignored. (See [email-bugs#25](https://github.com/hteumeuleu/email-bugs/issues/25).)

style.description: An HTML element to contain style information, in CSS, for a document or part of a document.

notes.1: Buggy. Requires a background on the `<body>`. Can be any type of background, image or a color, can be set as attribute, inline style or in `<style>` block
notes.2: Not supported. Element is removed along with any fallback content.

svg.description: Support for embedded `<svg>` images. See [SVG html](/features/image-svg) for linked external SVG support.

notes.1: Not supported. `target="_blank"` is forced on all links.
notes.2: Supported. But `target="_blank"` is forced if the attribute is missing.
notes.3: The attribute is supported but links always open in a new window anyway.

target.description: Where to display the linked URL on `<a>` elements.

notes.1: Buggy. Email scrolls to the end when space bar is pressed.  This can be fixed by wrapping the `<input>` in `<ul role="presentation">`.
notes.2: Buggy. Screen jumps when input is in focus.
notes.3: Buggy. A number of android clients will not show the keyboard when the input is clicked.  Copy and pasting text works.
notes.4: Not supported. `<textarea>` is transformed into `<notextarea>`.
notes.5: Buggy. Interacting with the element submits the form it belongs in.

notes.1: The `<video>` element is supported, but not the inner `<source>` element so no video can play.
notes.2: `<video>`, `<source>` and `<track>` tags are replaced by `<u></u>` tags.
notes.3: Buggy. Support depends on the version of Internet Explorer installed.
notes.4: `<video>`, `<source>` and `<track>` tags are stripped. The fallback content is shown instead.
notes.5: Partial support. Requires the `controls` attribute to play.
notes.7: The `<video>` element is supported and the `poster` image is visible, but the video can not play due to a strict Content Security Policy.
notes.8: The `<video>` element is supported, but the video can not play due to a strict Content Security Policy.
notes.9: Not supported. The `<video>` element and all its content is removed.
notes.10: Not supported. The `src` attribute is replaced by `data-src`.
notes.11: Partial support. The video can be played by doing a right click and play. But `autoplay` and `controls` are not supported.

notes.1: Partial. Supported with non Google accounts only.
Partial. `` elements are wrapped in a `` so `left` and `right` values have no effect.
notes.2: Partial. Not supported on `` elements.
notes.3: Partial. `left` and `right` do not work on `<table>` elements. Use `float:left` or `float:right` styles instead.

align.description: This deprecated HTML attribute indicates how an element can be aligned, either horizontally (`left`, `center` or `right`) or vertically for elements like images (`top`, `middle`, `bottom`).

notes.1: Buggy. `id` prefix mismatched. The `id` value is prefixed but not the `aria-describedby` value.
Buggy. `id` is removed.
notes.2: Buggy. `id` prefix mismatched. The `id` value is prefixed but not the `aria-labelledby` value.

notes.1: Unable to trigger live change to test.
notes.2: Code isn't stripped but can't trigger a live change.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
notes.2: Partial. Only supported on the `<body>` element.

background.description: The HTML `background` attribute can only be used on `<body>`, `<table>`, `<td>` and `<th>` elements.

notes.1: Buggy. Percentage width on `` elements are based on the physical file's width, not on the parent element's width.
notes.2: Buggy. Sizes set in attributes don't scale in 120 dpi mode.

notes.1:
Does not support the unquoted attribute value syntax `
`
Not supported on `<td>` elements.

lang.description: The `lang` attribute lets you declare the language of the content of an HTML element.

notes.1: The `loading` attribute is supported, but not confirmed whether it works according to spec.
notes.2: The `loading` attribute is supported by the email client, but not by the browser engine.
notes.3: Not supported. The webmail adds `loading="lazy"` to all images.

loading.description: The `loading` attribute on `img` indicates how the browser should load the image.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with Hotmail/Outlook accounts.
notes.2: Partial. The `popovertarget` attribute is supported, but the `popover` attribute and the `dialog` element are not.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with Hotmail/Outlook accounts.
notes.2: Partial. The `popovertarget` attribute is supported, but the `popover` attribute and the `dialog` element are not.

notes.1: Partial. Only supported with non Google accounts.
notes.2: Partial. The `required` attribute is supported, but form elements are not.

notes.1: Not live tested, only looked at processed code on Litmus.
notes.2: Partial. Only works on the `<table>` tag.

notes.1: Buggy. The attribute is supported, but the webmail has default styles setting all `<td>` to `vertical-align:top` in CSS.
Buggy. Percentage width on `` elements are based on the physical file's width, not on the parent element's width.
notes.2: Buggy. Sizes set in attributes don't scale in 120 dpi mode.
notes.3: The `width` attribute is ignored on CID embedded images. See [#171](https://github.com/hteumeuleu/caniemail/issues/171).

notes.1: Supports `accent-color` but rendering depends on browser support.
Supported. But a default style of `margin:auto` is applied on every element and can prevent the expected result.
Buggy. Animation properties are supported but `@keyframes` are incorrectly prefixed.
notes.2: Partial. Only supports from and to keyframes. Does not support % keyframes

animation.description: Tests for the shorthand `animation` property and its longhand equivalents.

notes.1: Requires iOS 15.

aspect-ratio.description: Sets a preferred aspect ratio for the element

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts. But it can be used in the `background` shorthand property instead.
Buggy. Only supports [color keywords from CSS Level 1](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#color_keywords).
Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
notes.2: Buggy. Requires at least one `` element in the email to download all images.
notes.3: Partial. Does not support multiple values. The comma between two values is removed.
notes.4: Partial. Images URL must be between quotes.
notes.5: Background images can be used in VML. See [backgrounds.cm](https://backgrounds.cm/) and [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/web-workshop---how-to-use-vml-on-web-pages-----fill--element).
notes.6: Partial and buggy. Removes the entire `style` attribute or `<style>` tag when a `url()` function with a valid image URL is present. See [Gmail rolling out changes that strip CSS with background images](https://freshinbox.com/blog/gmail-rolling-out-changes-that-strip-background-image-css/) and [Gmail and background images](https://parcel.io/blog/gmail-and-background-images).

notes.1: Background images origin can be used in VML with the `origin` attribute. See [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/origin-attribute--fill--vml).
Partial. Does not support multiple values. The comma between two values is removed.
notes.2: Background images position can be used in VML with the `position` attribute. See [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/position-attribute--fill--vml).

notes.1: Partial. Does not support multiple values. The comma between two values is removed.
notes.2: Background images repetition can be used in VML with the `type="tile"` or `type="frame"` attribute. See [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/type-attribute--fill--vml).

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts. But it can be used in the `background` shorthand property instead.
notes.2: Partial. Does not support multiple values. The comma between two values is removed.
notes.3: Background images size can be used in VML with the `size` attribute. See [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/size-attribute--fill--vml).

notes.1: Partial. Does not support multiple values. The comma between two values is removed.
notes.2: Partial. Does not support the `/ value` shorthand for `background-size`. But it can be used in the `background-size` property instead.
notes.3: Partial. Only `background-color` values are supported.
notes.4: Partial. Images URL must be between quotes.
notes.5: Partial. Does not support multiple values. The entire property is removed if so.
notes.6: Partial. Does not support the `/ value` shorthand for `background-size`.
notes.7: Partial and buggy. Removes the entire `style` attribute or `<style>` tag when a `url()` function with a valid image URL is present. See [Gmail rolling out changes that strip CSS with background images](https://freshinbox.com/blog/gmail-rolling-out-changes-that-strip-background-image-css/) and [Gmail and background images](https://parcel.io/blog/gmail-and-background-images).

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with Hotmail/Outlook accounts.

conic-gradient.description: Creates an image consisting of a gradient with color transitions rotated around a center point (rather than radiating from the center).

backdrop-filter.description: Lets you apply graphical effects such as blurring or color shifting to the area behind an element.

border-collapse.description: Sets whether cells inside a `<table>` have shared or separate borders.

notes.1: Round corners can be used in VML with the `RoundRect` element. See [buttons.cm](https://buttons.cm/) and [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/msdn-online-vml-roundrect-element).
notes.2: Partial support. Shorthand for setting elliptical borders with the slash `/` notation is not supported e.g. `border-radius: 27% 73% 70% 30% / 30% 34% 66% 70%;`.

border-radius.description: The `border-radius` CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge.

border-spacing.description: Sets the distance between the borders of adjacent cells in a `<table>`.

column-fill.description: Support for the `columns` shorthand and longhand properties.

column-rule.description: Support for the `columns` shorthand and longhand properties.

column-gap.description: Support for the `columns` shorthand and longhand properties.

direction.description: Sets the direction of text or table columns.

notes.1: Partial support. `<number>` values are not supported as per CSS Fonts Level 4 where any `<number>` value between 1 and 1000 (inclusive) is a valid value. Only the following numeric values are supported: 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, and 900.
notes.2: Partial support. `<number>` values between 0 and 599 are set as normal font weight. `<number>` values between 600 and 1000 are set as bold font weight.

margin.description: Support for the `margin` shorthand property and the `margin-left`, `margin-right`, `margin-top`, `margin-bottom` properties.

margin-block-start.description: Support for the `margin-block-start` and `margin-block-end` css properties.

margin-block-end.description: Support for the `margin-block-start` and `margin-block-end` css properties.

margin-block.description: Support for the `margin-inline` and `margin-block` shorthand properties.

margin-inline.description: Support for the `margin-inline` and `margin-block` shorthand properties.

margin-inline-start.description: Support for the `margin-inline-start` and `margin-inline-end` css properties.

margin-inline-end.description: Support for the `margin-inline-start` and `margin-inline-end` css properties.

max-inline-size.description: Defines the horizontal or vertical maximum size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode

min-block-size.description: Defines the minimum horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode

Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.

object-position.description: The `object-position` CSS property specifies the alignment of the selected replaced element's contents within the element's box. Areas of the box which aren't covered by the replaced element's object will show the element's background.

notes.1: Buggy. `columns` property is stripped which is required for `orphans` to work

orphans.description: Sets the minimum number of lines in a block container split on an old page, region or column.

outline.description: Sets a line outside of the element's border.

outline-offset.description: Controls the position of an outline.

notes.1: Buggy. Cannot scroll through to hidden content.

notes.1: Partial. Only supported on table cells.

padding.description: This test includes support for the `padding` shorthand property as well as for `padding-left`, `padding-right`, `padding-top` and `padding-bottom`.

padding-block-start.description: Support for the `padding-block-start` and `padding-block-end` css properties.

padding-block-end.description: Support for the `padding-block-start` and `padding-block-end` css properties.

padding-block.description: Support for the `padding-inline` and `padding-block` shorthand properties.

padding-inline.description: Support for the `padding-inline` and `padding-block` shorthand properties.

padding-inline-start.description: Support for the `padding-inline-start` and `padding-inline-end` css properties.

padding-inline-end.description: Support for the `padding-inline-start` and `padding-inline-end` css properties.

notes.1: Partial. Supports `relative`, `absolute` but not `sticky` and `fixed`.
notes.2: Partial. Supports `sticky` but not `relative`, `absolute` and `fixed`.
notes.3: Partial. Supports `relative` but not  `absolute`, `sticky` and `fixed`.
notes.4: Partial. Supports `relative` and `sticky` but not `absolute` and `fixed`.

position.description: Tests for CSS positioning include `relative`, `absolute`, `fixed` and `sticky`.

notes.1: `resize` property is stripped from style tag
notes.2: Does not support `inline` and `block` values

resize.description: Sets whether an element is resizable, and in which directions.

shape-margin.description: Sets a margin for a CSS shape created using `shape-outside`

shape-outside.description: Defines a shape, which may be non-rectangular, around which adjacent inline content should wrap.

scroll-snap-type.description: Controls panning and scrolling behaviour with snap positions.

notes.1: Supports `tab-size` but doesn't support `white-space`. Therefore, `tab-size` is not effectively visible
notes.2: Supports `tab-size` but strips the tab character `	`

notes.1: Not supported. All tables are forced to `table-layout:fixed`.

table-layout.description: The table-layout property defines the algorithm used to lay out table cells, rows, and columns.

notes.1: Partial. Flow-relative values `start` and `end` are not supported.
notes.2: Partial. Flow-relative values `start` and `end` are not supported with non Gmail account.

text-align.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the content.

text-align-last.description: The `text-align-last` CSS property sets how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned.

notes.1: Supported with prefix `-webkit-`.
notes.2: Not supported, but the proprietary `text-underline-color` property can be used instead.
notes.3: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.

notes.1: Supported with prefix `-webkit-`.
notes.2: Not supported, but the proprietary `text-underline-style` property can be used instead with the keyword value `thick`.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
notes.2: Partial. Not supported with multiple values.
notes.3: Partial. `overline` is not supported.
notes.4: Partial. Only supports the line property, not style, color or thickness.
notes.5: Partial. Only supports style, color or thickness when written with long hand selectors.

text-decoration-line.description: Sets the kind of decoration that is used on text in an element, such as an underline or overline.

text-decoration-skip-ink.description: Specifies how overlines and underlines are drawn when they pass over glyph ascenders and descenders.

text-decoration-style.description: Sets the style of the lines specified by text-decoration-line.

text-emphasis-position.description: Determines the position of the emphasis mark.

text-emphasis.description: Applies emphasis marks to text commonly used in East Asian languages. Tests with text-emphasis, text-emphasis-color & text-emphasis-style properties.

notes.1: Partial. Negative values are not supported.
notes.2: Partial. Hard-coded negative values are not supported, but negative values as a result of the `calc()` function are supported.

text-indent.description: Support below refers to supporting a `<length>` value only. This does not include the new `each-line` or `hanging` keywords.

notes.1: Buggy. `text-justify` is stripped
notes.2: Partial. Depends on browser support
notes.3: Partial. `text-justify` is stripped except when the value is `inter-character`
notes.4: Partial. `text-justify` is stripped except when the value is `inter-word` or `distribute`
notes.5: Buggy. `text-justify` values `none`, `inter-word` and `distribute` are replaced with `inter-ideograph`

text-justify.description: Sets what type of justification should be applied to text when `text-align: justify;` is set on an element.

notes.1: Partial. `sideways` is not supported

text-orientation.description: Sets the orientation of the text characters in vertical mode.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.

notes.1: Partial. `lowercase` value is not supported.

text-underline-position.description: Specifies the position of the underline which is set using the `text-decoration property`'s underline value.

text-wrap.description: Controls how text inside an element is wrapped

0.description: The adjacent sibling combinator (`h1 + p`) allows to target an element that is directly after another.

notes.1: Partial. Can not be used with a class selector (`.test[class]`). Must be used solo (`[class]`) or with an element selector (`td[class]`).

notes.3: Buggy. A `class="test"` in the HTML is prefixed `class="x_test"`, but an attribute selector stays unprefixed `[class="test"]`.
notes.4: Partial. Only supports `[attr=value]` syntax.
notes.5: Partial. Only supports `[attr~=value]` syntax. Only `class` as an attribute name is known to be supported.
notes.6: Partial. Doesn't work with non Google accounts.

1.description: The attribute selector (`[attr]`) targets elements with this specific attribute.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
notes.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.

notes.4: Buggy. Only the first selector of the chain is prefixed in the styles, but all classes are prefixed in the HTML.
notes.5: Partial. Only when used as class or ID selectors

2.description: Chaining selectors (`.foo.bar`) allows to apply styles to elements matching all the corresponding selectors.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
notes.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.

3.description: The child combinator is represented by a superior sign (`>`) between two selectors and matches the second selector if it is a direct child of the first selector.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
notes.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.

4.description: The class selector (`.className`) allows to apply styles to a group of elements with the corresponding `class` attribute.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
notes.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.

5.description: The descendant combinator is represented by a space (` `) between two selectors and matches the second selector if it has ancestor matching the first selector.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.

6.description: The general sibling combinator (`img ~ p`) allows to target any element that after another (directly or indirectly).

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
notes.2: Buggy. The first `<head>` in the HTML is removed, so `<style>` elements need to be in a second `<head>` element.

lab.description: Modern color values: lch, lab, oklch and oklab

notes.1: Depends on browser support.
notes.2: Using this syntax for an inline style will remove all inline styles applied to that element.

oklab.description: Modern color values: lch, lab, oklch and oklab

notes.1: Gradients can be created in VML using `type="gradient"` on a `<v:fill>`. See [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/web-workshop---how-to-use-vml-on-web-pages-----fill--element#gradient-fill).
notes.2: Partial. Not supported with Hotmail/Outlook accounts.

linear-gradient.description: Creates an image consisting of a progressive transition between two or more colors along a straight line.

notes.1: Gradients can be created in VML using `type="gradientRadial"` on a `<v:fill>`. See [VML documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/vml/web-workshop---how-to-use-vml-on-web-pages-----fill--element#gradient-fill).

radial-gradient.description: Creates an image consisting of a progressive transition between two or more colors that radiate from an origin.

notes.1: Whitespace syntax is not supported (`rgb(0 128 0 / 1)`).
notes.2: Alpha value is not supported (`rgb(0, 128, 0, 0.5)`).
notes.3: whitespace syntax (`rgb(0 128 0)`): when used in the `style` attribute of an element, the whole attribute is stripped. When used inside `<style>`, the whole `<style>` block is stripped.

notes.1: Whitespace syntax is not supported (`rgb(0 128 0 / 1)`).
notes.2: whitespace syntax (`rgba(0 128 0 / 1)`): when used in the `style` attribute of an element, the whole attribute is stripped. When used inside `<style>`, the whole `<style>` block is stripped.

rgba.description: RGB functional notation with alpha-channel transparency value (`rgba()`)

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
Only supported if you’ve updated your OS with Safari 17.5 or later.
notes.2: Buggy. The function is supported but the color stays light even in dark mode.

light-dark.description: Enables setting two colors (one for light and the other for dark mode) for a property.

has.description: Represents an element if any of the selectors passed as parameters match at least one element.

notes.1: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
notes.2: Partial. Only supported on type selectors.

lang.description: Matches elements based on the language they are determined to be in.

notes.1: Not supported. But `@list` declarations can achieve the same thing.

marker.description: Selects the marker box of a list item (typically a bullet or number).

notes.1: Partial. Only supported through a `<link>` tag.
notes.2: Partial. Only supported directly through a `<style>` tag.
notes.3: Buggy. Support depends on the version of IE installed.
notes.4: Partial. The declaration is supported but distant fonts are ignored.
notes.5: Buggy. Elements using a font declared with `@font-face` ignore the font stack and fall back to Times New Roman. Use `mso-generic-font-family` and `mso-font-alt` to control the fallback.
notes.6: Not supported. Roboto and Google Sans can be used, but only because they're embedded with the webmail's own styles.
notes.7: Not supported. The `@font-face` declaration is kept but the `src` property is removed.
notes.8: Not supported when using a Microsoft email address; outlook, live, hotmail, etc.

@font-face.description: `@font-face` in CSS allows to include your own fonts inside an email.

@import.description: This is the description of the `@import` property.

notes.1: Not supported. The `@keyframes` declaration is kept but values are incorrectly prefixed.
notes.2: Partial. Only supports from and to keyframes. Does not support % keyframes

notes.1: Buggy. The first rule inside a media query is not prefixed.
Buggy. The first rule inside a media query is not prefixed.
Not supported. `@media (prefers-color-scheme)` is transformed into `@media ( _filtered_a )`.
notes.2: Not supported. `@media (prefers-color-scheme:dark)` is transformed into `@media none`.
notes.3: Additional custom `data` attributes (`data-ogsc`, `data-ogac`, `data-ogsb`, `data-ogab`) are added when viewing an email in dark mode. See [this article](https://www.hteumeuleu.com/2021/emails-react-outlook-com-dark-mode/) for examples.
notes.4: `@media (prefers-color-scheme:dark)` is transformed into `@media all` at run time if it applies.

prefers-color-scheme.description: This media query allows to theme for system light and dark mode.

notes.1: Not supported. `@media (prefers-reduced-motion:reduce)` is transformed into `@media none`.
Partial. Does not support nested media queries.
notes.2: Partial. Only supports `screen`, `min-width`, `max-width`, `min-height` and `max-height` based media queries.
notes.3: Buggy. Requires a double `<head>` hack to work.
notes.4: Partial. Does not support simple `@media {}` declarations.
notes.5: Buggy. The first rule inside a media query is not prefixed.
notes.6: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.
notes.7: Partial. Does not support height based media queries.
notes.8: Partial. Does not support landscape media query.
notes.9: Partial. Not supported with Hotmail/Outlook accounts.
notes.10: Partial. Nested media queries are removed.

hover.description: This media query tests whether the user's input device[s] (i.e mouse, trackpad etc.) can hover over elements

any-hover.description: This media query tests whether the user's input device[s] (i.e mouse, trackpad etc.) can hover over elements

notes.1: Properties not supported by the client are replaced by `_filtered_a` inside the parenthesis.
notes.2: Not supported. `@supports` is transformed into `@media not all`.

apng.description: Support for animated PNG image format

notes.1: Support depends on browser and operating system support.
notes.2: Does not support animated AVIF.
notes.3: Converts still AVIF into a jpg and animated AVIF into a gif.

avif.description: A modern image format based on the AV1 video format.

notes.1: Partial: Does not render Base 64 gif format.
notes.2: Not supported. The `src` is turned into a `nosrc` attribute.
notes.3: Partial: Only supports Base 64 png format.

notes.1: Buggy. An image renders but the colours are incorrect.
Partial: Does not support animated gif images.
notes.2: Partial: With an Office 365 account, it plays the animation 3 times then stops and shows a play button to reactivate the animation.

notes.1: Partial: Converts file to jpg.
notes.2: Supported on macOS 14 Sonoma.
notes.3: Partial. Webmail rendering depends on browser support.

notes.1: Only supported in Safari.
notes.2: A similar can be achieved using the [`dynsrc` attribute](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/internet-explorer/ie-developer/platform-apis/ms533742(v=vs.85)).

mp4.description: WebKit in Safari supports loading H.264 encoded MP4 video with an HTML tag or as a CSS background.

notes.1: Partially supported. Only works with non Google accounts.

svg.description: Support for SVG image format, as a linked file. See [SVG html](/features/html-svg) for embedded SVG support.

notes.1: Buggy. An image renders but the colours are incorrect.
notes.2: Partial. Does not render with non Google accounts.

notes.1: Partial: Converts file to jpg.
notes.2: Partial. Webmail rendering depends on browser support.
notes.3: Partial. Does not support animation.

notes.1: Buggy. `target=_blank` is added on links so anchors open in a new window.
notes.2: Buggy. Anchor links go back to the homepage of the webmail because it also uses anchor links for navigation.
notes.3: Buggy. Clicking an anchor link does nothing.
notes.4: Buggy. Opens a new browser window with the anchor as a URL.
notes.5: Buggy. Opens a new in-app browser window on yahoo.com with the anchor appended to the URL.
notes.6: Buggy. Targeted content is partially hidden by the application UI on top.
notes.7: Partial. Works when targeting an empty anchor with the corresponding `name` attribute, but not with `id` attributes.
notes.8: Not supported. Opens a new window with the same email.
notes.9: The `name` and `href` attributes are prefixed by a specific `mailruanchor_` prefix.

notes.1: Partial. `cc` and `bcc` are not supported.
notes.2: Not supported. The link opens a contact card inside the app.
notes.3: Partial. `bcc` is not supported.

mailto.description: The `mailto:` URL scheme allows to create links that open a new outgoing email message. It supports different parameters corresponding to header fields, like `cc`, `bcc`, `subject` and `body`.

notes.1: Partial. The `var()` function is supported, but not the variable declaration.
notes.2: Partial. Not supported with non Google accounts.

notes.1: Partial. Only supported in lowercase. (See [email-bugs#13](https://github.com/hteumeuleu/email-bugs/issues/13))
notes.2: Partial. Only supported inline when using a Non Gmail Account due to the lack of `<style>` support.
notes.3: Not supported. The entire declaration is removed if there is no space before `!important`.
notes.4: Partial. Only supported with a space before.
notes.6: Partial. Only supported inline due to the lack of `<style>` support.
notes.7: Partial. Removed if there is no space before when used with a `background-image` property. (See [email-bugs#16](https://github.com/hteumeuleu/email-bugs/issues/16))

notes.1: Buggy. Renders as if there was no doctype with an Outlook email, and in HTML5 otherwise.
notes.2: Not supported. The HTML5 doctype has no impact here.
notes.3: Partial support. Depends on the version of Internet Explorer installed.
